description: Variation of condition 2 (Approved Plans), condition 16 (Cycle Spaces), condition 17 (Car Parking), Condition 23 (Energy Report) and Condition 25 (Photovoltaic Panels) to account for a minor material amendment including changes to the proposed feature cladding to the hotel, increasing the number of guest rooms from 158 to 168, a revision to the entrance area and canopy, introduction of roof top plant, introduction of clad plant boxed and minor revisions to the car park layout to planning permission P/2011/3529 dated 04/07/012 for the  Hybrid Planning Permission for the Demolition of the existing buildings on the site and full planning permission for the development of a part one/part seven storey building to create a 158 bedroom hotel (C1 use class) with a total Gross Internal Area (GIA) of 6850 square metres on the western part of the site fronting onto the A40 Western Avenue and Masons Green Lane, with associated parking, public realm improvements and landscaping. Redevelopment of remainder of the site (0.4 hectares) to provide employment uses, comprising of an indicative office (B1 use class) and associated landscaping, public realm improvements, car and cycle parking, with an approximate GIA of 1870 square metres and an indicative Data Entry Centre (B8 use) and associated landscaping, car and cycle parking with an approximate GIA of 4980 square metres located towards the rear of the site (Outline Planning Permission - Access being sought with Layout, Scale, Appearance and landscaping matters to be reserved)
decision_conditions: The hotel development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers and associated documents:  Drawing Numbers 050H-002 (Site Plan),  050H-003, 050G-004, 050G-006, 050G-007, 050G-008, 050G-009, 050G-010, 050-012 Rev D.   Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Details of 18 covered cycle parking spaces to service the hotel development hereby approved and as indicated on approved plan 050-012 Rev D shall be provided on site prior to occupation of any part of the development hereby approved and shall be permanently retained thereafter.      Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for cycle parking within the site, in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan 2011. | The car/vehicular and coach parking spaces shown on approved plan 050-012 Rev D shall  be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the hotel development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose. 	 Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car and coach parking within the site, in accordance with policy 6.3 of the London Plan 2011. | The development shall be implemented in accordance with the sustainability measures set out in the submitted Energy Report (Issue 7, dated 6/10/2014) prepared by MTT which demonstrates that the development will achieve an overall (minimum) reduction in carbon dioxide emissions by 25.27% (regulated carbon dioxide emissions) above Building Regulations 2010 and maintained as such thereafter.  Reason: To ensure that the development is energy efficient and contributes to reducing the need for fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity, and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases in accordance with policies 5.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 5.7 of the London Plan 2011, National Planning Policy Framework. | Details of the scheme of photovoltaic panels, which shall provide for no less 2.33% on-site C02 reduction as detailed within the Sustainability Appraisal and Energy Strategy Report (Issue 7, dated 6/10/2014) prepared by MTT, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the practical completion of the development. The approved photovoltaic scheme shall be installed and operational prior to the first occupation of the development. The details shall include:  a)	The resulting scheme; b)	 machinery/apparatus location assocoiated with the photovoltaics; and c)	 specification and operational details.  The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved and maintained as such thereafter.  Reason:  In the interest of sustainable development and combating climate change in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.7, and 5.8 of the London Plan 2011.
